text: The arrondissement of Poitiers is an arrondissement of France, in the Vienne department, Nouvelle-Aquitaine region. Its capital is the city of Poitiers. ==History== When the Vienne department was created on 1800, the arrondissement of Poitiers was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Poitiers is in western Vienne and is bordered to the north and northeast by the arrondissement Châtellerault, to east and south by the arrondissement Montmorillon, and to the west by the Deux-Sèvres department. It has an area of . It has 246,038 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². It is the arrondissement of Vienne with more people living in it but is the one with the smallest area. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Poitiers, there are 8 cantons whose communes are in the arrondissement: Chasseneuil-du-Poitou, Migné-Auxances, Poitiers-1, Poitiers-2, Poitiers-3, Poitiers-4, Poitiers-5, Vivonne and Vouneuil-sous-Biard. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Poitiers INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Châtellerault Montmorillon Poitiers 8601 Chasseneuil-du-Poitou 13 13 8607 Jaunay-Clan 1 7 8 8609 Lusignan 10 9 19 8611 Migné-Auxances 19 19 8613 Poitiers-1 3 3 8614 Poitiers-2 1 + part of Poitiers 1 + part of Poitiers 8615 Poitiers-3 part of Poitiers part of Poitiers 8616 Poitiers-4 1 + part of Poitiers 1 + part of Poitiers 8617 Poitiers-5 2 + part of Poitiers 2 + part of Poitiers 8618 Vivonne 16 16 8619 Vouneuil-sous-Biard 15 15 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Poitiers has 87 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes)ː #
